medical_history.chief_complaint: A 10-year-old girl with features of Albright hereditary osteodystrophy (AHO) and normocalcemic pseudohypoparathyroidism.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient's symptoms began at the age of 5 years with a slight delay in psychomotor and speech development. At that time, she was found to have primary hypothyroidism and elevated PTH levels. By age 10.5 years, she exhibited features of AHO, including a round face and brachymetacarpia of the fourth and fifth digits.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Primary hypothyroidism diagnosed at age 5, treated with levothyroxine.
medical_history.family_history: The affected mother and younger brother also showed reduced Gs/H9251 protein activity and the same mutation was found in them.
